name: Robert E. Kinicki
content: Bob Kinicki's Home Page Bob Kinicki Professor Emeritus Computer Science Department rek@wpi.edu As of July 1st 2016, I am a WPI CS Professor Emeritus. While officially retired, I remain involved with WPI through its Global Projects Program. In the C25 term I will serve as co-advisor with Professor Shockey for the Wellington Project Center in New Zealand. Additionally, I will serve as the advisor for the Wellington Project Center in D25. WPI President's 2020 IQP of the Year Zoom Presentations YouTube link LakeW's final New Zealand presentation: LakeW 2016 IQP Presentation with President's 2017 IQP Award Presentation Current: Activities | Undergraduate Global Projects Historic: Courses | Publications | Graduate Students | Undergraduate Projects I have a running bibliography of over 150 references concerning Wireless Sensor Networks at: WSN Bibliography 2013. Research Presentations prior to my retirement in July 2016: The Internet of Things: Introduction and Issues, Victoria University of Wellington Colloquium 16 February 2016 A Snapshot of IoT Puzzle Networks CS513 Advanced Computer Networks CS4516 Historic Courses Computer Networks CS4514 Operating Systems CS3013 Local Area Networks CS576/EE536 High Performance Networks C530/EE530 Basketball A set of CS faculty and students continue to play something that resembles basketball in Recreation Center on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays around the lunch hour. They welcome students to our games!! 50th Birthday Basketball Soccer A group of students and faculty play soccer on Tuesdays and Thursdays. When the weather permits we play on the football field beginning at noon. During the winter and under inclement weather, they play in Harrington Gym at noon.
